intro: Burmeistera gravida, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Burmeistera gravida is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
